I'm saying this to emphasise that I loathe singiing the praises of anything even tangentially related to Marvel, without also revealing that I have stashed a steel chair and bag of thumbtacks under the ring as a surprise attack against Kevin Feige.
Spider-Man is about as Marvel-related as you can get. I said back when the remaster of Insomniac's first Spider-Man game came to PC that the reason to not buy it was that Miles Morales was coming to PC in a few months. A few months has become now. And I must own that Marvel's Spider-Man: Miles Morales is a good game. It's a big, bold action adventure full of heroics and quips, and it's still the better Spider-Man game. I think a large part of that is because it's shorter.
Read more
articles.title: If you get one Spider-Man game on PC, get Marvel's Spider-Man: Miles Morales

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
I came, I saw, I claimed some free DLC. That’s probably what Julius Caesar would say about being given away for Sid Meier’s Civilization 6, right? Well, whatever his nibs might think about the offer, you’ll be able to pick him up for nowt from November 21st. There’s only one catch, and that’s needing to link your 2K account on Steam or the Epic Games Store. Have a watch of the trailer below to see what ol’ leaf-ears has to offer your Romans.

 
Read more
articles.title: Civilization 6 gets classic leader Julius Caesar for free next week, but...

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
For somehow the second time in my life, I recently found myself in deeply urgent need of a 4K gaming monitor. An RTX 4090 review deadline was rapidly approaching, any suitably UHD-specced loaner monitors I could use for testing had been sent back, and my backup – a nasty little 60Hz screen – wasn’t going to cut it. Unwilling to prostrate myself for another loan model and reluctant to burn such a vast hole in RPS’s expenses budget, I elected for the fastest, easiest option of just buying one myself.

 
Read more
articles.title: The surprising un-rubbishness of my secondhand, bargain bin 4K monitor

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
The mid-cycle patch for hero shooter Overwatch 2 has arrived to bring balance adjustments for multiple characters, and free Mei from her downtime at last. In particular, Zarya’s particle barrier duration has been reduced, so you should have an easier team taking her on in future. Blizzard announced there’d be a delay to the balance adjustment update earlier this week, which had been scheduled for November 15th. 

 
Read more
articles.title: Overwatch 2’s mid-season update brings back Mei and nerfs Zarya

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
An investigation into suspected insider trading by former Square Enix employees is underway, and Japanese news site Fuji News Network reports that Sonic The Hedgehog’s co-creator Yuji Naka has been arrested in connection. Naka is alleged to have bought around 10,000 shares in Dragon Quest Tact developers Aiming back in 2020 for ¥2.8 million (£16,800). At that point, Naka was still working with Square Enix on Balan Wonderworld.

 
Read more
articles.title: Sonic co-creator Yuji Naka reportedly arrested in Square Enix insider trading investigation

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
If you miss Tom Clancy's Splinter Cell’s three-eyed stealth monger Sam Fisher as much as I do then take a look below at some newly shared concept art from Ubisoft’s upcoming remake of the original game. It’s the first time we’ve got anything close to a glimpse of the remake, still in its early prototyping stage, could look like. The seven slices of concept art were shown as part of Splinter Cell’s 20th anniversary.

 
Read more
articles.title: Splinter Cell remake team share concept art before “going dark for a little while”

articles.author: Will Judd
articles.description:
The Razer Basilisk X Hyperspeed is the firm's budget answer to the G502 Wireless gaming mouse, but today it's way cheaper thanks to a big Black Friday discount at Amazon UK. The price has dropped from £60 to £30, making it one of the most affordable wireless gaming mice on the market - and a great deal given its six programmable buttons, 285 hour battery life and options for both reliable Hyperspeed wireless and Bluetooth. 
Read more
articles.title: Get the Razer Basilisk X Hyperspeed mouse for 50% off

articles.author: Will Judd
articles.description:
Golly. The EVGA P6 850W is a top-tier modular power supply, and today it's been discounted by nearly £40 over at Amazon. That drops it £73, a terrific deal on a PSU that can handle anything up to (and including) an RTX 4090. We actually covered this power supply last month, when I was surprised to learn it had dropped to £90 after weeks of costing more than £100 in the crypto-boom era. Now it's even cheaper, and that makes our recommendation stronger than ever. 
Read more
articles.title: A top-tier 850W EVGA PSU for £73 is an incredible early Black Friday PC deal

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
The Risk Of Rain intellectual property and both Risk Of Rain and Risk Of Rain 2 are now owned by Gearbox. Gearbox were previously the publisher of Risk Of Rain 2 and say they are "eager to prove ourselves as worthy custodians" of the series. They bought the IP from original developers Hopoo Games, who say they won't be doing any more work on the series.

 
Read more
articles.title: Risk Of Rain is now owned by Gearbox, but its developers remain independent

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
This year's Saints Row reboot met financial expectations, according to the interim report of mega-publisher Embracer. The same can't be said of the critical response, however, so developers Volition "will transition to become part of Gearbox."

 
Read more
articles.title: Volition will "become part of Gearbox" after critical reception to Saints Row

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
At a glance, Warhammer 40,000: Rogue Trader looks like so many other turn-based games set in the 40K universe. Except, this isn't turn-based strategy, but a proper CRPG from the makers of the recent, well-liked Pathfinder games. Its first gameplay trailer awaits below.

 
Read more
articles.title: Warhammer 40,000: Rogue Trader gets a new gameplay trailer

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Aska is a multiplayer survival game about building a settlement and farming, sailing and fighting giant monsters. So far, so Valheim. Aska's twist is that your settlement is also populated by a cadre of NPCs who you must protect and direct. There's an announcement trailer below ahead of closed alpha testing to begin at the end of the month.

 
Read more
articles.title: Aska is a co-op viking settlement builder with NPCs you can boss around

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Shadows Of Doubt invites skepticism. It's an open world mystery game set in a city in which every resident is simulated with daily schedules and routines, and it's developed largely by a single person. Shadows Of Doubt has also fought my skepticism so far with playable demos and, now, a new official trailer. It sure looks like it's doing the thing.

 
Read more
articles.title: Open world detective sim Shadows Of Doubt will launch early next year

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Following a nearly decade-long tradition, Dead Island 2 has been delayed. The co-op zombie smasher has slipped from its intended February 3rd 2023 release date and will now target release on April 28th 2023.

 
Read more
articles.title: Dead Island 2 has been delayed yet again, but only by 3 months

articles.author: Katharine Castle
articles.description:
Hot on the heels of their Solium Infernum announcement at the end of September, the studio behind strategy RPG Armello have announced another new game they're working on during tonight's PC Gaming Show Preview stream. It's called Jumplight Odyssey (or "J-Lo" for short, as League Of Geeks studio director and co-founder Trent Kusters affectionately referred to it during an early preview presentation I attended last week), and it's a starship roguelite colony sim that has big 70s anime vibes. Specifically, Star Blazers, the English adaptation of Leiji Matsumoto's seminal Space Battleship Yamato, with which Jumplight shares a lot of its core visual DNA. 
In it, you play as Princess Euphora, who's on a mission to save her people from the space conquering Zutopans, jumping from planet to planet in search of their Forever Star. It's not due to arrive in early access until sometime next year, but I've seen a sneak peek of it running in an early alpha build, and lemme tell ya. FTL, Rimworld and Two Point Hospital likers (bear with me on that last one) are going to want to take note of this.
Read more
articles.title: Armello devs are shooting for FTL meets Rimworld with their new roguelite colony sim

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Ever had a real-life experience where you’re something like 90% sure you’re actually in a horror film? Answers in the comments, please. Now, imagine that, but also someone asks you to pop your phone in a lockbox, you know, for safekeeping. Also, they say something like “You won’t need it where we’re going” and then do a murder wink at an imaginary camera. Something quite similar to this happens to our ill-fated documentary crew early in The Devil In Me. 'Aha!' I thought. Supermassive are being knowingly, playfully tropey again. Great. These games are best when they lean into the cheese like a drunk buffet guest, and I was pumped to watch it stumble around a schlocky murder party and get baked brie all over the elbows of its best tux.
For those yet to stick their snout into Supermassive’s truffle-trove of horror offerings, the basic premise of these narrative adventure games can best be summarised: What if shouting at the screen to try and stop idiot characters performing horror film no-nos actually worked? The formula was both invented and, miraculously, perfected in 2015’s Until Dawn. Since then, the studio have released three ‘episodic’ (although narratively independent) Dark Pictures titles, and The Quarry, all of which can best be summarised: Like Until Dawn, but not as good.
Read more
articles.title: The Dark Pictures Anthology: The Devil In Me review: fourth time’s charming but still not a charm

articles.author: Ollie Toms
articles.description:
Look, we can all agree that Spore is not quite the game it could have been. In terms of the different eras that you coach your little creature species through, the game peaks early on in the cell stage. After that, everything goes a little downhill. But I'll tell you what: I've never, ever been so excited for a game to release, and I don't think I ever will again. I was losing sleep over it. And there's one simple reason: the Creature Creator.
 Read more
articles.title: Have You Played... Spore?

articles.author: Rachel Watts
articles.description:
I’m always amazed by the Minecraft building community. We’ve seen the likes of Tolkien’s Middle-earth, Breath Of The Wild, Disneyland, Game of Thrones' Westeros, and the Star Wars universe all built block by block - and that’s only a short list of what you can find online. The creations you can find are honestly kind of amazing, and Minecraft builders are constantly putting out new masterpieces for fellow Minecrafters and non-crafters to oggle at all year round.
Read more
articles.title: Here are some cool af Minecraft builds that were made this year

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
If you’re going to go on the hunt for giant monsters then you'll need some serious technology to back you up. Upcoming hunting game Wild Hearts is packing plenty of what devs Omega Force are calling Karakuri, the magical flat-pack wooden kit the game’s warriors use to battle the various beasties in their fantasy take on medieval Japan. You can get a glimpse of some of the Karakuri battles that Wild Hearts contains in the trailer below, including a rather awesome looking monocycle and a furious monkey with a very nasty skin condition.

 
Read more
articles.title: Wild Hearts' new trailer has cool monocycles and a giant magma monkey

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Prodeje počítačů i komponent padají, výroba se nedaří, jak by si firmy přály a zákazník stále častěji pokukuje jinde. Svět IBM PC je zkrátka ve vleklé krizi, jejíž délka se už počítá v letech.
articles.title: Trh PC je v krizi: prodeje dlouhodobě klesají, výrobcům se nedaří

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jiří Eischmann)
articles.description: Mastodon používám od roku 2017, aktivně pak od doby, kdy skončil Google+. Poslední týdny nestačím zírat. Co bylo roky ospalou sociální sítí, se mění v živou platformu. Za všechno může jeden člověk – Elon Musk.
articles.title: Mastodon roste před očima: ustojí decentralizovaná síť příliv uživatelů?

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Ukážeme si zajímavou knihovnou nazvanou HTMX. Je napsaná v JavaScriptu a umožňuje tvorbu jednodušších webových aplikací a dynamických prezentací, pouze za použití jazyka HTML rozšířeného o několik nových atributů.
articles.title: HTMX: knihovna pro tvorbu stránek pomocí mírně rozšířeného HTML

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Hrach)
articles.description: V nedávném seriálu Pavla Tišnovského jsme se seznámili s vektorovými instrukcemi SIMD. V dnešním článku si ukážeme, jak jsem je použil při zrychlování konkrétního algoritmu.
articles.title: Použití instrukcí SSE a AVX pro zrychlení bitových operací

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Sonda do světa otevřeného softwaru. Dnes si vylepšíme rozlišení obrázků za pomoci umělé inteligence, vygenerujeme si kódy pro dvoufázové ověření, představíme si IDE pro začínající programátory a vyzkoušíme aplikaci pro správu kalendáře.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (23. 11. 2022): umělá inteligence zvyšuje rozlišení obrázků

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Sci-fi RTS Dark Reign: The Future of War z roku 1997 ožívá díky enginu OpenRA. Služba Prime Gaming od Amazonu funguje nativně na Linuxu díky projektu Nile. Někdo prodával svobodnou hru 0 A.D. na Steamu bez vědomí vývojářů.
articles.title: Dark Reign na OpenRA, Prime Gaming na Linuxu přes Nile

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Popíšeme si způsob zobrazení stromových struktur, jak se zobrazují tabulky s formátovaným textem, zobrazení dat umístěných do sloupců a v neposlední řadě si ukážeme například postupné zobrazení prováděné činnosti (progress bar).
articles.title: Tisk naformátovaného a obarveného textu na terminál s knihovnou Rich (dokončení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: CESNET CERTS)
articles.description: V dnešním díle se ponoříme do kontejneru, přečteme si dopisy, o které nestojíme, rozpleteme Kerberovy zamotané hlavy, naučíme se hlásit zranění, necháme se opakovaně okrást a povíme si, jaká používáme hesla.
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: co najdeš v kontejneru

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Prostředí Unity bylo portováno na Arch Linuxu a jeho dceřiné distribuce. Vyšlo OpenBSD 7.2 s podporou Ampere Altra Q80–30 a Apple M2. Operační systém Zeal je modernizovanou odnoží 64bitového TempleOS.
articles.title: Unity na Arch Linuxu, OpenBSD 7.2 s podporou Ampere Altra Q80–30

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Intel Arc v Linuxu 6.2 už ne jako experimentální, plus měření výkonnostních parametrů DG2/Alchemist v rámci Mesa, Micron vydal storage engine HSE 3.0 jako open-source.
articles.title: AMD otevřela Radeon Raytracing Analyzer, KDE řeší 137 chyb

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Kudrhalt)
articles.description: V říjnu byla zcela ochromena společnost Metro AG u nás provozující síť velkoobchodů Makro. Po útoku, který postihl také pobočky v Německu, Francii, Rakousku a také v České republice přestaly fungovat zákaznické čipové karty, e-shop pro službu Delivery a nebylo například možné používat stravenky.
articles.title: Společnost Metro AG opět pod útokem

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Bezpečnostní analytici společnosti Microsoft varují před bezpečnostními problémy spojenými se zastaralým webovým serverem Boa. Ten už nemá podporu od roku 2005, ale je stále rozšířený v různých zařízeních jako jsou routery, bezpečnostní kamery, průmyslová zařízení či součásti energetických sítí.
articles.title: Útočníci zneužívají starý webový server Boa k napadání síťových zařízení

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Analytická firma Jon Peddie Research zpracovává pravidelné čtvrtletní zprávy o situaci na trhu s grafickými kartami. Nejnovější čísla ukazují na hlubokou krizi v celém trhu s počítači, přičemž nejhůře je na tom firma AMD. Letošní třetí kvartál, zahrnující období od července do září, byl mimořádný, protože praskla kryptoměnová bublina a uživatelé zároveň čekali na vydání nové generace karet.
articles.title: Prodeje grafických karet klesly nejvíc od roku 2009, Radeony jsou na rekordním minimu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Microsoft vyvíjí podporu pro linuxové aplikace ve Windows už několik let. Nyní nástroj zvaný Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) dosáhl verze 1.0.0 a uživatelé jej mohou začít stahovat. Důležitou změnou je, že tato verze je dostupná přes Microsoft Store a je to také výchozí způsob instalace. To umožňuje oddělit aktualizace WSL nových verzí od vydání Windows.
articles.title: Windows Subsystem for Linux je možné stahovat a aktualizovat přes Microsoft Store

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: V srpnu se do jádra dostaly patche vývojářů Intelu vylepšující běh na hybridních CPU Intel (tedy loňské 12. generaci Core Alder Lake a letošní 13. generaci Raptor Lake) v tom smyslu, že nedocházelo tak často k přehazování úloh mezi jednotlivými SMT doménami. Nyní Intel přichází s vylepšenou verzí těchto algoritmů a běh hybridních CPU Intel zase bude o něco efektivnější a rychlejší.
articles.title: Nové patche zlepšují běh hybridních CPU Intel i HT/SMT

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Vilém Sládek)
articles.description: Správci sítí, provozovatelé peeringových uzlů nebo zástupci majitelů datacenter z celého světa se již mohou registrovat na tradiční, v pořadí již 10., konferenci Peering Days. Ta se uskuteční příští rok v březnu (28. až 30. března) v bulharské Sofii. Tuto již tradiční akci, na kterou každý rok přijedou stovky účastníků, připravují opět zástupci peeringových uzlů z Česka (CZ.NIC), Maďarska (BIX) a Rakouska (VIX), lokálním hostitelem je tentokrát bulharský BIX.BG.
articles.title: Organizátoři mezinárodní konference Peering Days spustili registraci

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: OBS Studio 28.1 před třemi týdny přidalo podporu AV1 na kartách Nvidia GeForce RTX 4×xx. Budoucí verze 29 jejíž beta je nyní na světě totéž zprovozní i s příslušně vybavenými GPU od AMD a Intelu.
articles.title: OBS Studio 29 Beta přidává kódování AV1 videa pro GPU AMD a Intel

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Nový nástroj pro čištění metadat ze souborů, zvaný Metadata Cleaner, je hlavní novinkou čerstvě vydaného operačního systému Tails 5.7. Nahrazuje dřívější řešení MAT, které s vydáním Tailsu 4.0 přišlo o grafické rozhraní. Metadata Cleaner podporuje stejné formáty souborů jako MAT a je i neméně tak bezpečný (ostatně v pozadí sám právě MAT používá).
articles.title: Tails 5.7 přináší nástroj Metadata Cleaner

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Proxmox je moderní virtualizační platforma, která v mnoha případech může nahradit VMware. Je open-source, zdarma a je postaven na otevřených technologiích jako KVM, LXC, CEPH a dalších. Pokud potřebujete provozovat virtualizaci, Proxmox je pro vás ideální stack a na našem workshopu se dozvíte, jak na něj.
articles.title: Proxmox: moderní virtualizační platforma schopná nahradit VMware (online školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Po půl roce od předchozího vydání byla uvolněna nová pravidelná verze linuxové distribuce Alpine Linux, tentokrát s označením 3.17.0. Výchozí verzí knihovny OpenSSL je nyní 3.0, starší verzi 1.1 je možné získat skrze balíček  openssl1.1-compat. PHP 8.0 bylo nahrazeno verzí 8.1 a Rust je nyní k dispozici pro všechny podporované platformy.
articles.title: Alpine Linux 3.17.0 přináší OpenSSL 3.0 a DHCP server ISC Kea

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Vývoj firmwaru Dasharo pro základní desky MSI s čipsetem Z690 pokračuje. Nově je s verzí 1.1 podporována i DDR5 varianta, tedy model MSI PRO Z690-A WiFi DDR5. Uživatel také může vypínat / zapínat řadič PS/2 a je zde i volba resetování klíčů Secure Boot na výchozí
articles.title: Dasharo 1.1 pro MSI Z690, podpora DDR5 i vypnutí Management Engine

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: vkotyk)
articles.description: Další meetup pro všechny nadšence do Golang, ale i DevOps/SRE, je tady – ve středu 30. listopadu 2022 od 18:00. Těšit se můžete na témata od lidí ze SentinelOne, Outreach i přímo organizátora Ladislava Prskavce, jako:
articles.title: Příští Prague Golang Meetup #9 proběhne už 30. listopadu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Nadále platí to, že firma Razer na podporu svých produktů v Linuxu zvysoka nedbá, avšak komunita vyvíjí projekt OpenRazer. Ten v nové verzi 3.5 přináší podporu dalších zařízení:
articles.title: OpenRazer 3.5 podporuje šest dalších zařízení

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Na světě je nová vývojová verze editoru GIMP v rámci řady 2.99, která jednoho (už nepříliš vzdáleného) dne vyústí v přelomovou verzi 3.0.Tvůrci tentokrát zpracovali na nové interaktivitě nástroje Align and Distribute, nových volbách obrysů o textového nástroje či automatické aktivaci nástroje Transformace.
articles.title: GIMP 2.99.14 ukazuje nový šedý vzhled prostředí

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Vilém Sládek)
articles.description: Sdružení CZ.NIC dnes pořádá svoji tradiční konferenci Internet a Technologie (IT 22). Její on-line přenos je možné sledovat na webu www.nic.cz/it22/. Akce začíná v devět hodin a na programu jsou přednášky věnované projektům Turris,, Knot DNS, mojeID, správě sítí nebo internetové bezpečnosti. Záznamy jednotlivých prezentací budou poté k dispozici na webu konference.
articles.title: Dnes se koná konference Internet a Technologie, sledujte on-line přenos

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Calculon)
articles.description: Společnost Julia Computing, založená tvůrci jazyka Julia, se přejmenovala na JuliaHub podle svého hlavního produktu, cloudové platformy pro vědecké aplikace založené na Julii. Jak tvrdí Stefan Karpinski, jeden z tvůrců Julie a spoluzakladatel společnosti, „people in the Julia community often think the company is already named JuliaHub. It only makes sense to rename the company to reflect that focus and direction.“
articles.title: Společnost Julia Computing se přejmenovala na JuliaHub, vyšla alfa verze 1.9

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Nové grafické karty NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4090 a 4080 mají problém v někerých základních deskách a bez ovladačů nic nezobrazují, monitor je prázdný. Například po zapnutí BIOS nic nezobrazuje.
articles.title: Nový firmware pro NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4090 a 4080

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Bluetooth Special Interest Group minulou středu ohlásil nové specifikace pro Bluetooth LE (BLE). Nově se budou používat kromě 2,4 GHz i frekvence 6 GHz, podobně jako u Wi-Fi 6E a Wi-Fi 7. Důvodem je stále větší rušení na 2,4 GHz.
articles.title: Bluetooth LE bude používat 6 GHz

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Je tu opět období zvýšeného výskytu virových onemocnění a to jak chřipky, tak i COVID-19. Wes Hardaker z Kalifornie cestoval na konferenci IETF (Internet Engineering Task Force) do Londýna a chtěl vědět, jak je to s rizikem přenosu infekce. Použil malý CO2 monitor Aranet 4 (u nás stojí asi 4 tisíce), který umožňuje posílat data po Bluetooth například do Androidu, pak můžete data exportovat do CSV. Pro vykreslení grafu použil vlastní malý program v Pythonu.
articles.title: Monitorování CO₂ a riziko přenosu virových onemocnění

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: VPN umožňuje bezpečně propojit různá zařízení pomocí šifrovaných tunelů. Umožňuje také zapojit uživatele do vnitřní sítě přes zabezpečený přístupový bod. Na našem školení VPN a bezpečné připojení k síti s OpenVPN si prakticky ukážeme, jak to celé nastavit a zprovoznit.
articles.title: Vytvořte si bezpečnou VPN pomocí OpenVPN (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Generální konference pro míry a váhy včera schválila čtyři nové předpony pro jednotky mezinárodní soustavy SI. Jedná se o ronna ( R) pro 1027, quetta ( Q) pro 1030, ronto ( r) pro 10-27 a quecto ( q) pro 10-30.
articles.title: Nové předpony SI ronna a quetta

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Domény populárního serveru Z-Library s ilegálními e-knihami (z-lib.org, b-ok.org, 3lib.ne a další) byly začátkem měsíce zabaveny Ministerstvem spravedlnosti USA. Dohromady je domém 249. Server nabízel asi 11 miliónů knih a asi 84 miliónů článků, dohromady 220 TB dat.
articles.title: Zatčeni majitelé Z-Library z Ruska

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Před necelými dvěma měsíci se objevily grafické karty NVIDIA Geforce RTX 4090. Ty mají velkou spotřebu TDP 450 W, ale při přetaktování i přes 600 W. K napájení se používá nový 16pinový konektor PCIe 5 12VHPWR. V něm 6 párů drátů přivádí každý až 9,5 A při 12 V, tedy až 680 W. Poslední 4 dráty jsou pro komunikaci se zdrojem.
articles.title: U grafických karet NVIDIA Geforce RTX 4090 se taví napájecí konektor

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Ve středu vyšla databáze SQLite ve verzi 3.40.0. Mezi novinkami je podpora WebAssembly (WASM), tedy běh například v prohlížeči. Podpora WASM je zatím označena jako beta, stabilní by měla být v příštím vydání 3.41.
articles.title: SQLite 3.40 s podporou WASM

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: anonymní)
articles.description: Bruce Byfield ve spolupráci s Jean Hollis Weberovou vydává druhé vydání knihy Designing with LibreOffice. Jedná se o aktualizaci první verze z roku 2016.
articles.title: Aktualizované vydání knihy Designing with LibreOffice

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Umíte vymyslet software, naprogramovat ho, zabalit do kontejneru a předat do produkce? Také vám říkali, že se open sourcem nedá uživit? Přijďte to zkusit u nás!
articles.title: Lone Wolf Developer for Linux

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Nová metoda slibuje automaticky optimalizovat kód pro kvantové počítače. CDoS: prý nás čekají útoky virtuálních asistentů. HPE rozšiřuje podnikové portfolio superpočítačů Cray. Proč je studené ukládání dat stále důležitější a jakou roli v něm hraje DNA. Top strategické technologické trendy pro rok 2023.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: CDoS – prý nás čekají útoky virtuálních asistentů

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 46/2022

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Umělá inteligence porazila lidské odborníky při předpovědi chování proteinů. Našli černou díru nejblíž Zemi. Dá se inflační kosmologie falzifikovat? Polarizované rentgenové paprsky odhalují tvar a orientaci hmoty kolem černé díry. Kafe a koronavirus.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Nanotrubičky z nitridu boru překonávají ty uhlíkové

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Fedora Linux 37 byl odložen až na polovinu listopadu. Zato ještě v říjnu vyšla druhá aktualizace Tails, a pak v první polovině listopadu byla vydána nová reinkarnace distribuce Gnoppix mezi aktualizacemi řady dalších linuxových distribucí: PrimTux, OSGeoLive, OSMC, Peppermint OS, GParted Live a Clonezilla live nebo Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8 a odpovídající AlmaLinux.
articles.title: Distribuční novinky 43-45/2022

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Suverénní cloud podle VMware. Výdaje na IT v regionu EMEA vzrostou v roce 2023 o 3,7 %. Lockheed Martin a Red Hat spolupracují na vývoji umělé inteligence pro vojenské mise. Do 180 zemí světa poskytuje z Česka podnikové a IT služby již 160 tisíc zaměstnanců. Ochrana dat v cloudových úlohách: DRaaS vs. BaaS. Umělá inteligence jako recenzent.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Umělá inteligence jako recenzent

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Proč nepotkáváme mimozemšťany? MOND vs. temná hmota. Superkondenzátory z grafenu obohaceného dusíkem. Letokruhy stromů zachytily záhadné radiační bouře. Zlato se sráží na grafenu.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Galaktické civilizace mají preferovat dlouhověké hvězdy

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 45/2022

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Pro ty, kdo se připravují na sestavení nového počítače, bude mít Goodoffer24 příležitost věnovat větší rozpočet na hardwarové díly, nebo si dopřát nějaké další licence, které mohly být proškrtány jako první. Tato příležitost vyvstala díky nabízeným velkým slevám v porovnání s oficiálními ceníky.
articles.title: Goodoffer24: Dvojitý prodej Microsoftu za nízké ceny: aktivace doživotní licence Windows 10 jen za € 12 a Office za € 23

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Přehled říjnových vydání Jaderných novin: stav vydání jádra, citáty týdne a seznam článků týkajících se jádra.
articles.title: Jaderné noviny – přehled za říjen 2022

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Podniky směřují k multicloudu. Monitoring, visibility, observability – jak se vyznat ve sledování sítě. Globální investiční společnost KKR získává Ness Digital Engineering. Pure Storage rozšiřuje model as-a-service v rámci celého portfolia Portworx. Identické fotony dokázali vyrobit v různých kvantových tečkách.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Monitoring, visibility, observability – jak se vyznat ve sledování sítě

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Wasmer byl vydán ve verzi 3.0. Jedná se o běhové prostředí pro programy ve WebAssembly. Zdrojové kódy jsou k dispozici na GitHubu pod licencí MIT. Nejnovější Wasmer umí přímo spouštět WAPM (WebAssembly Package Manager) balíčky.
articles.title: Wasmer 3.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byl vydán Stable Diffusion 2.0 (GitHub). Jedná se o open source AI systém pro generování obrázků z textu.
articles.title: Stable Diffusion 2.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána verze 0.8.0 operačního systému Redox OS (Wikipedie). Jedná se o mikrokernelový unixový operační systém naprogramovaný v programovacím jazyce Rust. Zdrojové kódy jsou k dispozici na GitLabu pod licencí MIT.
articles.title: Redox OS 0.8.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Dne 16.9.2022 se v Brně konala mezinárodní konference Open Source Driving the European Digital Decade, na které byl diskutován rozvoj Open Source technologií ve veřejném a akademickém sektoru. Jedním z cílů této konference bylo také nastartovat diskusi o vzniku české národní OSPO kanceláře (Czech National OSPO) neboli uskupení složené ze zástupců veřejného, akademického a soukromého sektoru, které by rozvoj Open Source technologii dále rozvíjelo v ČR a pomohlo by napojit domácí open source komunitu dále na mezinárodní prostředí. Jedním z výstupů konference je vytvoření deklarace s názvem: Brno Open Source Declaration: The story of the Czech National OSPO, která slouží jako nástroj pro další kroky směrem k založení národního OSPO centra v Brně.
articles.title: Brno Open Source Declaration: The story of the Czech National OSPO

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Na GOG.com běží Black Friday Sale. Při té příležitosti lze získat zdarma počítačovou hru Narita Boy (Wikipedie, ProtonDB).
articles.title: Hra zdarma: Narita Boy

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: V lednu bylo oznámeno, že Anaconda, instalátor používaný v linuxových distribucích Fedora, RHEL nebo CentOS, bude webová. Nyní je k dispozici ISO obraz s první veřejnou verzí Anaconda Web UI preview.
articles.title: Anaconda Web UI preview

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Microsoft informuje, že Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) ve verzi 1.0.0 je dostupný v Microsoft Store pro Windows 10 a 11.
articles.title: Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) 1.0.0 v Microsoft Store pro Windows 10 a 11

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Na stránkách Free Software Foundation Europe (FSFE) lze podepsat otevřený dopis FSFE adresovaný zákonodárcům Evropské unie o právu instalovat jakýkoli software na jakékoli zařízení.
articles.title: Otevřený dopis FSFE adresovaný zákonodárcům EU o právu instalovat jakýkoli software na jakékoli zařízení

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Nadace Raspberry Pi oznámila, že jednočipový počítač Raspberry Pi Pico pro africký trh vyrábí v Keni v Nairobi v Gearbox Europlacer. V plánu je také tamní výroba Pico W a Zero 2 W.
articles.title: Raspberry Pi Pico Made in Kenya

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Na blogu Asahi Linuxu, tj. Linuxu pro Apple Silicon aneb počítače Apple s novými ARM procesory M1, M1 Pro, M1 Max, M1 Ultra a M2, byl publikován listopadový přehled dění a novinek z vývoje.
articles.title: Novinky z vývoje Asahi Linuxu - listopad 2022

articles.description: Landing this week within Mesa 23.0 is an initial implementation of Vulkan's VK_KHR_present_wait extension, which Hans-Kristian Arntzen of Valve's Linux team and VKD3D-Proton notoriety has referred to as a "very useful" extension but due to current spec limitations is for now only being made opt-in via a DriConf option so it can be handled on a per-game/app basis...
articles.title: Valve Implements Opt-In VK_KHR_present_wait For Mesa Vulkan Drivers

articles.description: It was just last week that Qualcomm unveiled the Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 flagship SoC and thanks to their work with Linaro engineers, there are already patches under review for enabling this high-end Snapdragon chipset for the mainline Linux kernel...
articles.title: Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 Patches Already Surfacing For The Linux Kernel

articles.description: Mesa 22.3 had been expected to release this week but instead Mesa 22.3-rc4 was issued and in turn the v22.3 introduction is now expected for next week...
articles.title: Mesa 22.3-rc4 Brings Many Fixes, Official Release Now Expected Next Week

articles.description: Red Hat is out this week with a new version of Stratis, its Linux storage solution built atop XFS and LVM that is intended to provide features and functionality akin to ZFS and Btrfs but with the proven reliability of XFS...
articles.title: Stratis 3.4 Released As The Latest Open-Source Linux Storage Work From Red Hat

articles.description: The Qt Group today announced the release of Qt Creator 9 as the newest feature release to this open-source Qt/C++ focused integrated development environment...
articles.title: Qt Creator 9 Released With Experimental Squish Support

articles.description: After more than a half-year of development work, Redox OS 0.8 released today as the newest version of this from-scratch, Rust-written open-source operating system...
articles.title: Rust-Written Redox OS 0.8 Released With i686 Support, Audio & Multi-Display Working

articles.description: A patch was merged today to Mesa 23.0 as part of the effort for building the Intel OpenGL and Vulkan Linux drivers for non-x86/x86_64 architectures. This is part of the ongoing effort to enable Intel discrete GPUs to eventually work on the likes of AArch64, POWER, and RISC-V systems...
articles.title: Intel Mesa Driver Changes Land For Building On Non-x86 CPUs

articles.description: Back in August an Intel engineer posted a patch series to help Linux on Intel hybrid CPUs with Hypr Threading. That work benefiting newer Alder Lake and Raptor Lake processors is around avoiding unnecessary migrations within SMT domains. Finally an updated version of that patch series has now been posted as this Intel hybrid improvement works its way toward the kernel...
articles.title: Intel Posts Reworked Linux Patches To Improve Hybrid CPU + HT/SMT Kernel Behavior

articles.description: Over the past year since being the first to report on Software Defined Silicon (SDSi) for license-activated hardware features with future CPUs, we've been left to wonder all what will be incorporated into this controversial Software Defined Silicon. Intel recently shared that SDSi will be marketed as Intel On Demand and now they have published a web page outlining more about this after-purchase upgrades for activating extra processor features...
articles.title: Intel Details The Accelerators & Security Features For On Demand / Software Defined Silicon

articles.description: Valve has officially released Proton 7.0-5 as the newest version of their Wine downstream that powers Steam Play for enjoying countless Windows games on Linux, most notably now with the Steam Deck. Valve has also introduced "Proton Next" as their new testing grounds for future Proton updates...
articles.title: Proton 7.0-5 Gets More Games Running On Linux & The Steam Deck

articles.description: It was just a little more than 24 hours ago that SDL 2.26 released for this widely-used library by cross-platform games and other software for abstracting software/hardware interfaces. With SDL 2.26 released, SDL 3.0 is now in development. One of the first stages of that big Simple DirectMedia Layer update is removing a lot of old platform code and other obsolete targets...
articles.title: SDL3 Begins Dumping A Lot Of Old Code: GLES1, OS/2, DirectFB, WinRT, NaCl & More

articles.description: PoCL 3.1 is nearing release as the "Portable Computing Language" that is most known for serving as a CPU-based OpenCL implementation but via its LLVM usage also allows supporting OpenCL execution atop NVIDIA CUDA and other targets...
articles.title: PoCL 3.1-RC1 Released With Improved SPIR-V Support For CPU & CUDA Drivers, Vulkan WIP

articles.description: OBS Studio 29 Beta 1 has been released as the newest test version for this widely-used, cross-platform open-source software for screen-casting and screen-recording purposes. OBS Studio 29 most notably is adding AV1 hardware-accelerated encoding for Intel Arc Graphics and AMD Radeon GPUs...
articles.title: OBS Studio 29 Beta Brings AV1 Encode For AMD & Intel GPUs

articles.description: While the Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) has been around for six years now and with WSL2 is on to running graphical Linux apps with GPU acceleration and a wide array of capabilities, including the ability to run systemd and the like, only today has Microsoft promoted WSL to "general availability" status on Windows 10 and Windows 11...
articles.title: Microsoft Promotes Windows Subsystem For Linux "WSL" To GA Status

articles.description: It's that time of the year with "Black Friday" this week and the start of the holiday shopping season. As usual, there is the annual holiday deal for Phoronix Premium to enjoy it at a discounted rate. Unfortunately the state of the ad industry and rampant ad-block use continue to greatly hurt the sustainability of the site while Phoronix Premium allows for enjoying the website ad-free and multi-page articles on a single page...
articles.title: Phoronix Premium Black Friday Deal To Support Open-Source News, Linux Hardware Testing

articles.description: Alpine Linux as the distro that is focused on being lightweight, simple, and secure with its use of OpenRC, BusyBox, musl libc, and other components is out with a big update...
articles.title: Alpine Linux 3.17 Released With OpenSSL 3.0, Better Rust Support

articles.description: The Asahi Linux crew has published their November 2022 status report highlighting recent open-source progress on supporting Apple Silicon M1/M2 devices under Linux...
articles.title: Asahi Linux Project Makes Progress On USB3, Toward Speaker Support, Keyboard Backlight

articles.description: One of the exciting open-source milestones this year was Dasharo/Coreboot being ported to a modern Intel Alder Lake Z690 motherboard that is readily available and at a decent price. That work by the open-source firmware engineers at 3mdeb was focused on the MSI PRO Z690-A WiFi DDR4 motherboard while with today's v1.1 release there is also support now for the MSI PRO Z690-A WiFi DDR5...
articles.title: New Dasharo v1.1 Firmware For The MSI Z690 Board - DDR5 Variant Now Supported, ME Disable

articles.description: After open-sourcing its Radeon Raytracing Analyzer code last week, this week AMD's GPUOpen team has a new open-source project announcement: Brotli-G...
articles.title: AMD Releases Brotli-G For GPU-Accelerated Brotli Compression

articles.description: Intel has published a new version of its oneVPL library as its open-source oneAPI Video Processing Library for video encoding/decoding and media processing across CPUs, GPUs, and other accelerators...
articles.title: oneVPL 2023.1 Released For Intel's Open-Source Video Processing Library

articles.description: Red Hat engineer Jan Grulich has written a year-end summary about the ongoing work for supporting Wayland-based screen sharing for the Google Chrome/Chromium web browser. The code still isn't enabled by default but given the strides being made that could change "sooner than later" if all goes well...
articles.title: Wayland Screen Sharing For Chrome/Chromium Improving - Enabled By Default Soon?

articles.description: SDL 2.26 has been officially released as the latest version of this widely-used library by cross-platform games and other software wishing to abstract various hardware/software differences between systems. With the release of SDL 2.26 out, SDL 3.0 is now officially under development...
articles.title: SDL 2.26 Released, SDL3 Development Now Underway

articles.description: In the early days of Wayland one of the main philosophical driving points for this alternative to the X.Org Server was that "every frame is perfect" and would forego screen tearing among other rendering impurities. Introduced now with Wayland Protocols 1.30 though is a new staging protocol to allow screen tearing...
articles.title: Wayland Protocols 1.30 Introduces New Protocol To Allow Screen Tearing

articles.description: The AMD EPYC 4th Gen "Genoa" processor performance has been outright phenomenal. These new AMD server processors have shown stunnning performance with up to 96 cores per socket and beyond the increased core count is now up to 12 channels of DDR5-4800 memory and most significantly in the HPC space is the introduction of AVX-512 support with Zen 4. Even the 32-core high frequency Genoa performance has been dominating against Intel's current Xeon Scalable competition. While AMD EPYC Genoa brings very impressive gains generation-over-generation and against the current Xeon Ice Lake CPUs, curiosity got the best of me for seeing how the new AMD EPYC CPUs compare to AMD's original EPYC 1st Gen "Naples" flagship - the EPYC 7601 2P. Here are Genoa benchmarks showing how far the AMD server/HPC CPU performance has evolved over the past five years since Naples.
articles.title: The Epic Gains Made In 5 Years For AMD EPYC 7601 Naples vs. Newest 4th Gen EPYC Genoa

articles.description: Intel open-source engineers continue working on getting their Trust Domain Extensions (TDX) support squared away for the mainline Linux kernel. With the upcoming Linux 6.2 cycle, the TDX guest driver is now ready...
articles.title: Intel TDX Guest Driver Ready Ahead Of Linux 6.2

articles.description: Introduced last week as part of Vulkan 1.3.235 was the new VK_EXT_descriptor_buffer extension. NVIDIA issued a same-day Vulkan beta with support for this new capability while now the open-source Mesa Radeon Vulkan driver "RADV" has added support for it too and there is also VKD3D-Proton usage for this new extension pending...
articles.title: RADV Wires Up VK_EXT_descriptor_buffer, VKD3D-Proton Usage Pending

articles.description: Following the development builds over the summer, Wasmer 3.0 was officially released this weekend as the newest feature release for this open-source software aiming to serve as a universal WebAssembly runtime with a goal to "run any code on any client" via WebAssembly...
articles.title: Wasmer 3.0 Released As The Latest "Universal WebAssembly Runtime"

articles.description: This summer saw official Ubuntu Linux images released for the StarFive VisionFive RISC-V board while now Canonical engineers are working to ensure their Linux distribution is all squared away for the upcoming VisionFive 2...
articles.title: Ubuntu Bring-Up Happening For The StarFive VisionFive 2 RISC-V Board

articles.description: Last week with Linux 6.1-rc5 there was concerns raised by Linus Torvalds that the v6.1 cycle may need an extra week of testing and fixes. Now Linux 6.1-rc6 is available with Torvalds' latest prognosis for the Linux 6.1 kernel cycle...
articles.title: Linux 6.1-rc6 Released - Still Coming In Larger Than Torvalds Would Like

articles.description: While Razer still sadly isn't officially supporting their various gaming-focused computer peripherals under Linux, the OpenRazer project providing open-source drivers for Razer products continues working out well and offering broad hardware support under Linux...
articles.title: OpenRazer 3.5 Brings Support For Newer Razer Devices On Linux

articles.description: One of countless great open-source projects from Intel over the years is IWD as a modern wireless daemon for WiFi devices on Linux. IWD has been in the works for over a half-decade as a new replacement to wpa_supplicant and with time has implemented many features and seen widespread adoption. Released this week was IWD 2.0 as the latest milestone for this open-source wireless daemon...
articles.title: Intel's IWD 2.0 Released For Modern Linux Wireless Daemon

articles.description: Last week when launching the AMD EPYC 9004 "Genoa" processors, AMD released AOCC 4.0 as the newest version of their optimizing C/C++ compiler that now supports their Zen 4 micro-architecture. Last week I ran some initial AOCC 4.0 benchmarks and this LLVM/Clang downstream was looking rather favorable in relation to upstream LLVM/Clang, while since then I've been able to conduct more thorough benchmarks across a wide variety of C/C++ open-source workloads. Here is that more extensive round of AOCC 4.0 benchmarking against the open-source LLVM/Clang and AOCC compilers.
articles.title: AMD AOCC 4.0 vs. GCC vs. LLVM Clang Compiler Benchmarks On Zen 4
What If 2 Gift Guide
Change in Slope

articles.author: Chris Carter
articles.description:
Also, it's Thanksgiving
If you celebrate it, happy Thanksgiving! If not, there's a few games to potentially pick up.
The marquee on for this small-ish week is The Knight Witch, which is due out on November 29 on the Switch eshop (also on Steam). It's a promising looking Metroidvania, with a few interesting concepts (like accessibility/mechanical toggles) and a spell system that also promises shmup gameplay.
That's pretty much it in terms of this week. Things will start picking up a little more as we head into the holiday season, and things quiet down in mid-December or so.

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
Get. in The Ring
SNK has offered up more information pertaining to the second season of its excellent team-scrapper The King of Fighters XV — From January 2023, new characters, modes, and under-the-hood tech tweaks will begin a steady rollout across all platforms, bringing further excitement to one of the long-running franchise's best-ever entries.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kCsTzOoWZZ0
Season 2 starts with the dawning of the new year, bringing with it a brand new character balance update and the first DLC fighter of season 2: Kyo Kusanagi fanboy and good-hearted goof Shingo Yabuki. As winter turns to spring, the taekwondo master and bringer of JUSTICE, Kim Kaphwan, will make his eagerly awaited return to the ring. Evildoers beware.
In addition, spring will see SNK launch an open beta test for its new crossplay functionality, allowing fighters to test their mettle across PlayStation, Xbox, Steam, and Epic Games Store platforms. Across the remainder of the year, fans can expect more characters and balance patches. This will hopefully keep fan fervor up for what has been a successful first year for The King of Fighters — easily the most relevant that a KoF title has been on the global FGC stage in many years.
The King of Fighters XV is available now on PlayStation, Xbox Series X, and PC platforms.
The post The King of Fighters XV season 2 kicks off January 2023 appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: The King of Fighters XV season 2 kicks off January 2023

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
Season’s greetings from Destructoid’s least-American writer
It's that time of year again! And as the Destructoid office closes for a much-earned weekend of merriment, it is once again up to yer boy Moyse to celebrate a holiday that has absolutely nothing to do with him. That's fine, because I like spending the holidays with you. Besides, you're never alone if you have a talking Dusa plush from Fangamer. Anywhoo, 'tis Thanksgiving, or Friendsgiving, or Turkey Day, or even Turkee Day (for my vegan pals). Whatever you call it, it amounts to good food, a weirdly aggressive bout of Black Friday capitalism, and a much-needed break from the ol' nine-to-five.
It can be tough to find thanks lately, after all, we are still somewhat mired in a relatively unhappy global situation. It has been this way…
articles.title: It’s Thanksgiving! What are you thankful for this year in gaming?

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
Cult fighter to receive major upgrade
SNK's fab and precise fighting title Samurai Shodown is currently preparing to make a comeback, bolstered by the power of some slick new rollback netcode. The developer announced that it will hold an open beta in January 2023 to test the sword-slashing title's new functionality.
The beta test will be held on the Steam edition of Samurai Shodown. It will offer SNK the opportunity to fine-tune the stability of the fighter's online mechanics ahead of the official rollback rollout, currently scheduled for spring 2023. Rollback netcode will be applied to the PlayStation, PC, and Xbox ports of Samurai Shodown, though the Nintendo Switch and (inevitably) Stadia releases will be missing out.
The arrival of rollback netcode, albeit three years late, will be very welcome to SamSho's devoted community. The 2019 reboot is unique among its fighting brethren, both in its visual design and its playstyle, and as such it deserves a new lease of life. Here's hoping that the update will help bring back some of those wandering ronins to a game that, frankly, deserves a better reputation within the fighting game community.
Samurai Shodown is available now on PS4, PC, Xbox One, and Nintendo Switch.
https://twitter.com/SNKPofficial/status/1595598325608218624?s=20&t=CtCKGc1TIrQFcSci7H8IWw
The post Samurai Shodown rollback beta coming to Steam January 2023 appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Samurai Shodown rollback beta coming to Steam January 2023

articles.author: Eric Van Allen
articles.description:
A gorgeous upgrade to Geralt's big quest
CD Projekt Red showcased the upcoming next-gen update for The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt today, and it looks pretty great. From big updates to small little changes, it seems like a really good excuse to dive back into this massive RPG.
The special REDstreams showcase aired today, going over the details of what's to come for the update. While it's a next-gen boost for The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt on PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X|S, PC owners will also be able to take advantage of the tune-ups too. To start, here's a trailer:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nBT2SP21f3Q
On the graphics side of things, consoles will get the option for a performance or graphics mode. Performance will target 60 FPS, while the graphics will aim for 30 FPS with ray tracing.
PC play…
articles.title: CD Projekt Red shares what’s in store for The Witcher 3 next-gen update

articles.author: Eric Van Allen
articles.description:
A fresh look at what Dead Island 2 has been up to
Dead Island 2 is rising from the beyond to share more of what the team's been working on. A new Dead Island 2 showcase is scheduled for Tuesday, December 6.
The stream will kick off at 1 p.m. PT / 4 p.m. ET, with the Dead Island 2 showcase airing on the Dead Island YouTube channel. You can find that link here.
https://twitter.com/deadislandgame/status/1595462356230115329
What's the team planning to showcase? Well, so far we just have a description of "action, gore, and zombies." Hopefully we get to see some details of what's in store for the long-in-development sequel to Dead Island.
Rising from the grave
It's at least another sign of life from the Dead Island 2 project, which has been in the works for quite a long time at this point. We did get confirmation of a release date and details at Gamescom earlier this year, but publisher Deep Silver confirmed last week that it's been pushed from February out to April 28, 2023.
“The irony of delaying Dead Island 2 is not lost on us, and we are as disappointed as you undoubtedly are,” reads a statement from Deep Silver on the delay. “The delay is just 12 short weeks and development is on the final straight now; we’re going to take the time we need to make sure we can launch a game we’re proud to launch. For those of you who’ve been waiting for years, thank you for hanging in there with us.”
More delays tacked onto Dead Island 2 is one thing. But players also probably want to know what the game looks like after so many years. The zombie-smashing, weapon-crafting action of Dead Island could be pretty fun to play again. It's just a matter of getting it onto platforms and out of the lab.
We'll see if the showcase delivers on December 6.
The post A Dead Island 2 showcase is set for December 6 appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: A Dead Island 2 showcase is set for December 6

articles.author: Timothy Monbleau
articles.description:
The best of the bad
I’ll be upfront here; I like Pokemon Scarlet & Violet. They move the series forward in several important ways, and there are moments here that are the highest highs of the franchise’s history. Pokemon Scarlet & Violet are also ridiculously buggy. The performance issues are so rampant that they will impact your experience, regardless of your tolerance for low framerates. This is unacceptable for the largest multimedia franchise on the planet.
But you know what? I've had some hearty laughs encountering glitches in this game. There are so many weird, unpredictable oddities in Scarlet & Violet that I almost look forward to discovering them. In a perfect world, Game Freak would have intentionally made Pokemon do weird stuff in the background just for the player’s amusement. …
articles.title: Top 5 Funniest Glitches in Pokémon Scarlet & Violet

articles.author: Eric Van Allen
articles.description:
No need to tack on some more tales just yet
Ragnarok has come and gone for the God of War series. And it sounds like Sony Santa Monica Studio is letting the latest Kratos and Atreus adventure stand alone for now, as God of War Ragnarok DLC seems unlikely.
In a spoilercast about God of War Ragnarok over at Kinda Funny Games (thanks for the spot, Eurogamer), director Eric Williams guested to discuss his game. At one point, he's asked about whether DLC is on the way for God of War Ragnarok.
"I don't know man, that game is big," said Williams. "I think we put everything we had into it, so I wouldn't count on it."
While there are updates in store for God of War Ragnarok, adding features like the photo mode, the stance on significant additions isn't too surprising. God of War (2018) didn't receive any extra DLC.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hfJ4Km46A-0
Patience, boy
I haven't rolled credits on Ragnarok yet myself, but my understanding is that it's a fairly conclusive story. The sequel is the conclusion to the Norse duology that Sony Santa Monica Studio has created, so I'd be surprised to see any lingering threads addressed in a DLC update.
Ragnarok is doing well in sales and reception too. And apparently Santa Monica Studio has other things on their plate to take care of, moving forward.
What could those projects be? Well, in the Kinda Funny spoilercast, Williams does mention he'd love to make a Castlevania game. It'd be a sight to see if that collaboration ever does work out.
The post God of War Ragnarok DLC seems unlikely, according to director appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: God of War Ragnarok DLC seems unlikely, according to director

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
Running with the pack
NetEase Games has made a "strategic investment" in the up-and-coming Polish studio Rebel Wolves. The Chinese holding company acquired a minority stake in the new developer, which was founded earlier this year by former members of The Witcher studio CD Projekt RED.
"We’re delighted to welcome NetEase Games as our new shareholder and partner,” said Rebel Wolves CEO Konrad Tomaszkiewicz in a press statement. "Having one of the leading global game companies get behind our vision is a great confidence boost and validation for the entire team at Rebel Wolves. Funding provided by NetEase was the last missing piece needed to go full throttle. With resources available to build a world-class AAA game, we can now focus on what matters most: development."
This "world-class AAA game" is the first project undertaken by the new studio and, in keeping with its team's strengths, is expected to be a dark, open-world RPG with an emphasis on character relationships and far-reaching player consequences. There is currently no solid information on the title's release date or platforms but, given the pedigree of CDPR, we can likely expect a pretty long wait ahead.
NetEase Games continues to spread its reach across global gaming development. While the studio had something of a falling out with Activision Blizzard this month, it also opened its first U.S.-based studio this year, Jackalope Games in Austin, Texas. NetEase also has minority and majority shares in partnerships with Quantic Dream, Grasshopper Manufacture, and Nagoshi Studio, led by Yakuza creator Toshihiro Nagoshi.
Despite the NetEase investment, Rebel Wolves will remain independently operated, maintaining full creative control over its projects as well as full ownership of its IPs and brands.
The post NetEase Games acquires minority stake in Polish studio Rebel Wolves appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: NetEase Games acquires minority stake in Polish studio Rebel Wolves

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
Overdone.
The long-running legal case regarding controversial Cooking Mama: Cookstar has finally drawn to its conclusion, with The International Court of Arbitration ruling that publisher Planet Entertainment did indeed infringe upon Office Create's IP with the 2020 release.
Available for PS4 and Nintendo Switch, Cooking Mama: Cookstar fell into controversy immediately, with rumors swirling that it utilized the Nintendo Switch hardware to mine cryptocurrency. Though Planet Entertainment stated that this wasn't the case, Cooking Mama IP owner Office Create filed suit against the publisher, stating that the company's right to use the Cooking Mama brand had expired — the initial build of the comical cook sim having been submitted and rejected back in 2018.
"Unfortunately, the quality of the game builds failed to meet the standards that our customers expect and deserve," said Office Create at the time. "Office Create rejected a wide range of deficiencies affecting the overall feel, quality, and content of the game.
"Yet, despite being contractually obligated to correct the identified deficiencies and resubmit the corrected game for Office Create's approval, Planet proceeded to release Cooking Mama: Cookstar without addressing all of the rejections and without Office Create's approval."
Following this week's legal ruling, Cooking Mama: Cookstar has been removed from the PSN Store and the Nintendo eShop, and all remaining physical copies must be removed from store shelves. To date, the most recent official Cooking Mama release was Apple Arcade title Cooking Mama: Cuisine! which launched in July of this year.
Court rules that Cooking Mama: Cookstar infringed upon Office Create's IP [GamesIndustry.biz]
The post Cookstar: Cooking Mama legal case finally reaches a verdict appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Cookstar: Cooking Mama legal case finally reaches a verdict

articles.author: Chris Carter
articles.description:
I've been asking for years, bring it on
In 2012, Nintendo released Kid Icarus: Uprising to the masses, and I was enamored. I couldn't put that game down for hours at a time, and amid some odd 3DS controls (that I did get used to!): it was one of my favorite games of that year, and that entire era. It was bubbling with more personality than the vast majority of games released even still, and it was like watching a cartoon in game form. 10 years later, Masahiro Sakurai is ready for it to make a return. 11 years ago, I was too!
In his latest game creation/development class video, Sakurai muses on difficulty: specifically, how Kid Icarus approached the concept with "the fiend's cauldron." In case you skipped over Uprising entirely (which is extremely likely!), the gist is that players can set …
articles.title: Sakurai coyly asks for a Kid Icarus: Uprising console port – and he’s completely justified

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
End of line for Onoma
Square Enix Montreal, which recently changed its name to Onoma, has announced that it is to shut down service for four of its mobile titles. The quartet of games will officially end service on January 4, 2023, ahead of the studio's announced closure.
Hitman Sniper: The Shadows; Deus EX GO; Arena Battle Champions; and Space Invaders: Hidden Heroes will be removed from the iOS App Store and the Android Store on December 1. Additionally, all in-game purchases have been suspended. On January 4, all four titles will be rendered unplayable. No refunds will be issued for the initial game purchase or any DLC downloads.
https://twitter.com/StudioOnoma/status/1595185541875748864?s=20&t=ewt1z8CoqL038UFXRPuhGw
Square Enix Montreal, founded back in 2011, was mostly focused on the creation of mobile and free-to-play titles, finding a small but dedicated audience with its GO strategy series, which utilized famous IPs such as Hitman, Tomb Raider, and Deus Ex. The studio was picked up earlier this year as part of a transaction that saw holding company Embracer Group acquire much of Square Enix' western subsidiaries, including studios Crystal Dynamics and Eidos Montreal, along with their respective IPs.
Soon after, it was announced that Square Enix Montreal was rebranding as Onoma, which appeared to signal a new lease of life for the company. However, in a shocking turn of events, the studio's closure was announced mere weeks later.
The post Square Enix Montreal to shut down four mobile releases appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Square Enix Montreal to shut down four mobile releases

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
5.1 million sales in launch week
While everybody, from developer to media to players, was expecting Sony Santa Monica's epic sequel God of War Ragnarok to light up the cash registers with the fury of Helios, perhaps nobody was quite expecting it to immediately become the fastest-selling launch in PlayStation's entire history, as decreed by the industry giant itself.
Over the course of its debut week, God of War Ragnarok shifted a staggering 5.1 million combined physical and digital copies, not only breaking launch records for the long-running mythological franchise, but also beating launch records for every single first-party game in PlayStation history, dating right back to the brand's debut in 1994. That's a meaty feat.
God of War Ragnarok is available now on PlayStation platforms.  And it seems folks are into it.
https://twitter.com/PlayStation/status/1595432230750674945?s=20&t=qSazuZ38JJ6L0vCuhO6bzg
The post God of War Ragnarok had the fastest selling first-party launch in PlayStation history appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: God of War Ragnarok had the fastest selling first-party launch in PlayStation history

articles.author: Chris Carter
articles.description:
Season 11 is coming on December 6
An an interesting move, Bethesda has revealed the theme for season 11 of Fallout 76: and it's going to fold over into the upcoming December 6 expansion. Yep, it's none other than Nuka-World, complete with a season map that depicts the theme park before the post-apocalyptic setting of the series.
Like past seasons (wow, has there really been 11 at this point?), Nuka-World will offer "cosmetics, CAMP items, atoms, caps, and more" as you progress through the track. There's a short trailer you can watch below that shows off the season offerings/rewards, as well as some of the expansion itself.
As a reminder, the ammo box is also coming, but only if you pay up for the game's subscription service: "Active Fallout 1st members can also unlock exclusive rewards and special S.C.O.R.E. boosts throughout the Season, but there’s more! This update also grants an all-new feature for Fallout 1st members at no additional charge: the Ammo Box! Keep unlimited numbers of your bullets, shells and such in safekeeping, like the existing Scrap Box currently available to Fallout 1st members. Note that the Ammo Box is for stackable ammo types only and won’t store Fusion Cores or Plasma Cores."
In addition to a few other "holiday games," I'm thinking I might hunker down and play through this expansion when things get slower in mid-December: the game is in a decent place to recruit friends into, especially with Game Pass.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GfLWJ30kIvs
The post Fallout 76’s Nuka-World expansion theme will be incorporated in the season pass appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Fallout 76’s Nuka-World expansion theme will be incorporated in the season pass

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
Mid-range. Midriff.
With the arrival of a new Guilty Gear Strive combatant, we see the return of Arc System Works' super-handy Starter Guide series, giving us the ins and outs of the new fighter in order to get players up and running — And this time around, it is the turn of ass-kicking offspring Sin Kiske!
Sin Kiske, as his name denotes, is the son of Guilty Gear's regal poster boy Ky Kiske, his mother being the ethereal Half-Gear, Dizzy. As such, Sin has inherited her Gear blood, bolstering the fighting abilities handed down by his father. As a relatively young man of great spirit, Sin is far more happy-go-lucky than his parents, boasting a somewhat cocky attitude and untamed personality. But his heart is just and true, and he remains a stalwart defender of the good and righteous, operat…
articles.title: Guilty Gear Strive Starter Guide returns, led by Sin Kiske and his abs

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
Five gongs for The Lands Between
Last night saw the arguable start of awards season, with the return of the annual Golden Joystick Awards, an institution that has now run for some four decades. Presented by GamesRadar, the 2022 edition of the veteran UK ceremony saw almost three million votes cast by the gaming public, hoping to shine a spotlight on the many titles that have entertained them over the past 12 months.
And, in what may prove to be something of a portent for things to come, Bandai Namco's challenging fantasy adventure Elden Ring was the big winner on the night, walking away with five awards in total including Ultimate Game of the Year and the Critic's Choice award, (as well as, curiously, Best Multiplayer). Devolver Digital's Cult of the Lamb took home the Best Indie Game gong…
articles.title: Elden Ring wins big at the 2022 Golden Joystick Awards
